duties_responsibilities.duty: Reorganization/clean up of SSWI cards and Skills Matrix to ensure up-to-date records.
Check and ensure employees are compliant with SSWI and provide necessary training and assistance.
Work with C&F leadership to update journeyman, apprentices, and craftsmen lists aligning with skill levels/pay grade and employee knowledge.
Oversee the organization and completion of OJT paperwork, ensuring proper filing and documentation.
Perform internal safety audits and ensure compliance with safety procedures, including hoist reports, forklift sheets, and baghouse reports.
Conduct daily visual board audits, ensuring proper completion and reporting deficiencies to supervisors.
Assist with improvement projects and 5S enforcement in the plant, including feedback collection and problem area resolution.
Assist in the preparation of reports, maintain a filing system, and communicate with the team to address deficiencies.
Contribute to the research, collection, and implementation of new programs, procedures, and systems.
Demonstrate flexibility for off-shift work and adaptability to work across different working conditions and environments.
Participate in safety activities, follow safety rules and procedures, and contribute to safety committees and initiatives.

Take responsibility for activating potential, caring for customers, optimizing operations, and integrating sustainability into daily practices, promoting a results-driven culture aligned with long-term value creation.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Operations Management, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's preferred)
